title: The decluttering trend
intro: Do you have too much stuff? If so, you're not alone. These days people tend to buy and keep more things than they used to. But what do we do with it all once we've had enough of it? Recently, people have been trying to find ways to reduce the amount of stuff that they own. Rob and Neil find out all about the latest decluttering trend, how to do it and why in this 6 Minute English programme!
this_week_question: The vacuum cleaner is a machine we use to clean our houses. When were the first mechanical floor cleaners, which later became vacuum cleaners, invented? Was it:
a) the 1860s? b) the 1890s? Or c) the 1920s?
Listen to the programme to find out the answer.

(a problem) to deal with a problem and try to fix it
with an emotional and/or nostalgic connection
an expression that means to use what you’ve got and fix something if it breaks rather than buying new things
